Text.Value: He went to make sure those 'strays' could go.
Never took you for a coward.
So that's what you want? To kill a bunch of innocents?
Good. Not another word then.
By letting that child escape without consequence?
Since they forced our hand.
Exactly as we have always done - tend this grove. Nothing has changed.
What will we do without a First Druid?
I can't believe he just left...
Oh? Because things went so well with Kagha?
It was steeped in shadow magic!
Stopping the ritual was the right thing to do.
What is Kagha thinking?
I'm no fan of those devils either, but they're leaving.
Don't say that.
What if they try to steal from us? Again?
Master Halsin's past his prime. It might be time for another.
The grove suffered because of Halsin. We have no need of him. Not anymore.
This isn't why I became a druid.
We'll find another way to stop them. We must.
If only we'd never let the tieflings in... the child might have lived.
He lost sight of what is important.
You think so?
Are you the one doubting her now?
We might as well lay down and let the goblins cut us up.
I still can't believe Master Halsin is dead.
Yet she failed - that's what matters.
We have the right to defend our home.
This will all be over. The ritual's almost finished.
Since when did we become killers?
What will happen to the grove? To us?
Like that'll do any good! That ritual was our salvation.
She's a child.

EditorData.NodeContext: incredulous, repeating other actor's phrase back to him

Text.Value: But to not even consult with us?
The ritual was flawed. It could've damaged the grove.
Master Halsin's home - by Silvanus' mercy.
They'll have to cut through all those tieflings first.
You have master Halsin to blame for that.

EditorData.NodeContext: incredulous, repeating other actor's phrase back to him

Text.Value: And if it comes to a fight? You'll not shy away from bloodshed I hope.
I don't want to kill anyone - but I won't let this grove be harmed. Not again.
We can't do the same.
Having second thoughts?
Ridiculous. We just let her run off?
I'm not.
It might've been better if he stayed away.
If it had been up to Kagha, they would never have been here at all.
I just hope they leave, and we can close this grove in peace.
And if the goblins get in here?
I pray the tieflings realise we are not to be trifled with.
We might as well have lain on the ground and let them trample us.
Master Halsin was a First Druid. None of us can match him in power.
It's not that. I just wish there was another way.
O-of course not! But this was our best defence!
We've shown them once - we take grove law seriously.
Come now. He took IN those strays, and then he just left!
I don't want blood on my hands.
I can. He let in outsiders, then rushed off - he's made one mistake after the other.
I know it.
A devil child. One who tried to steal from us.

Synopsis:
Situation: M and L are discussing the state of the grove. Scenario 1) Child has died. A child has died at the hands of Sagha - the druid they support. L is shaken by the encounter and having doubts. M believes the punishment was just and is even inspired to do similar to the other tieflings in the grove.

2) Child escapes. M is frustrated that the child fled 'without punishment'. He believes the other tieflings will take this as a sign that they can be walked all over. L isn't so sure.
